00028 #include "Utils.h"

00030 /* Function with behaviour like `mkdir -p'  */
00031 int
00032 mkpath(const char *s, mode_t mode){
00033     if (strcmp(s, ".") == 0 || strcmp(s, "/") == 0)
00034         return (0);
00035     
00036     if(index(s,'/')!=NULL) {
00037         char *copy = strdup(s);
00038         char *base = strdup(dirname(copy));
00039         
00040         mkpath(base, mode);
00041         
00042         //printf("Creating %s\n", s);
00043         mkdir(s, mode);
00044         
00045         free(copy);
00046         free(base);
00047     } else {
00048         //printf("Creating %s\n", s);
00049         mkdir(s, mode);
00050     }
00051     
00052     return 0;   
00053 }
00054 
00055 /* Create full path except for the last one, which is considered a file */
00056 int mkpathfile(const char *s, mode_t mode){
00057     int len = strlen(s);
00058     
00059     if(s[len-1]=='/') {
00060         mkpath(s, mode);
00061     } else {
00062         char *copy = strdup(s);
00063         char *base = strdup(dirname(copy));
00064         
00065         mkpath(base,mode);
00066         
00067         free(copy);
00068         free(base);
00069     }
00070 }
00071 
00072 bool
00073 stringHasEnding (std::string const &full, std::string const &ending)
00074 {
00075     return (full.length() > ending.length()) && (!full.compare (full.length() - ending.length(), ending.length(), ending));
00076 }
